title: MD/PhD RCR Refresher
description: The MD/PhD Program is developing a compact ethics refresher course which will satisfy the NIH requirement that graduate students who are supported on training grants and who have been enrolled full-time for longer than 4 years receive a Ã¢ÂÂrefresherÃ¢ÂÂ course in the responsible conduct of research. This pertains to MD-PhD students, who are typically enrolled in the Program for up to 8 years, and who are working in PhD labs beginning in year 4 of their enrollment. The NIH has specifically informed the MD/PhD Program that it needs to administer its own Ã¢ÂÂrefresherÃ¢ÂÂ course. In addition to subject matter requirements, it is essential that accurate attendance records are maintained for each source of funding. The course will be perceived as an elective, but in essence is mandatory for all MD/PhD students. The grading will be Satisfactory or Unsatisfactory. Members of the MD/PhD ProgramÃ¢ÂÂs Faculty Committee will lead the discussions.
